instruction: Explain the concept of integrative psychotherapy.
output: Integrative psychotherapy is an approach to therapy that combines various aspects of different therapeutic models, such as psychodynamic and cognitive-behavioral therapies, in order to best meet the needs of the client. This approach also incorporates elements from other disciplines, such as mindfulness and spirituality, which helps clients to understand, explore, and manage their mental health issues in an integrative and holistic way.
